content.description: This is now the rightmost route on the upper section of the Under the Sea Wall.  Begin at the tree, pull through the bulge, and then follow bolts to a new anchor about 10 feet higher and right of Under the Sea.
content.protection: 7-8 Bolts to 2 Bolt Rap Ring Anchor
content.location: Rightmost of the Upper tier of the Under the Sea Wall.

content.description:
Under the Sea

starts under a small roof and is somewhat tricky for the first 12ish feet.  Once past the roof the climbing eases up and feels more like the 5.9 next to it if not just a touch more difficult.  Very well bolted and fun!
content.protection: Draws (8 I think) to a 2 chain anchor.
content.location: Walk into Bear Canyon on the normal approach.  When you reach the 3 way intersection near the rock take a left and follow this above the tier that South Sea and Skin Diver on.  Take this little trail back about 40 feet to another tier with a large log lashed in between two trees.  This is the base of the climbs.

content.description: The right most route on this wall and another moderate to spread the load. Dedicated to the two young ladies climbing Sth Sea and talking about 'inadequate make-out' sessions with respective boyfriends while I was bolting above them! Crux through the middle flake and little overlap, like a lot of routes you can wander into some shitty rock looking for big holds.
content.protection: 7 bolts, Chain at anchors. Follow the bolt line. Tidied up some more loose flakes and it is good to go. Avoid straying out right as there are huge flakes ready to pop.
content.location: Start off ledge just right of Skin Diver look for first bolt to stop you toppling off the ledge and go from there.

content.description: Climb past the left trending crack following closely spaced bolts the entire way.  Some of the holds can have a gritty feel to them.
content.location: Hike into Bear Canyon as described previously and once up the steep hill take a left heading up to a tier below a large wall.  The tier is held in place by a log supported by webbing and cord.  This is the leftmost climb on this wall.

content.description: This route is the third from the left on the Under The Sea Wall. Like all the others it pulls the small bulge to start. A thin section on the slab is the crux before finishing up the the last couple of bolts of Coral Crimper.
content.location: From the upper tier of Under the Sea wall, this is the 3rd from the left. Find the start of Coral Crimper and move 10ft right

content.description: A climb on the lower tier of the left most crag, Skin Diver follows bolts up to a nice 2 bolt anchor with rings.  Very well bolted and pretty mellow for the grade it punches up the middle of the wall following small pockets and side pulls before surmounting a very small roof which is the crux.
content.location: To find Skin Diver head up the normal approach to Bear Canyon and once across the creek and up the hill it is the first left you can take.  Leads up to a tier that is anchored in by a log with webbing tied around it.  Skin Diver is the righter of the two climbs.

content.description: The middle most climb on this wall, C-Bucket punches up through a small overhang at the beginning and then ascends the slab above to a two chain anchor.
content.location: Walk into Bear Canyon on the normal approach.  When you reach the 3 way intersection near the rock take a left and follow this above the tier that South Sea and Skin Diver on.  Take this little trail back about 40 feet to another tier with a large log lashed in between two trees.  This is the base of the climbs.

content.description: The start onto the wall is much easier if you are over 6ft 1 but people will figure it out. Some great underclings and fun moves.
content.location: Start 15ft left of Coral Crimper (bolts are painted and harder to see) and follow obvious holds and bolts trending right.

climbs.name: It's Rice Jim (but not as we know it)
climbs.fa: Graham Charles (many TR prior to bolts)

content.description: Start just right of Skin Diver. A thin section at mid height requires a little more thought that SD. Dont wander too far into SD. Finish up the giant flake thing at the top to the chains of TMIH.
content.location: Line of bolts between SD and TMIH. Gives a leading option on an old TR route so the anchors on SD don't get monopolised. Clip and go. Finish at anchors for TMIH

content.description: The second route from the left heads straight up on smallish holds before traversing right (crux) onto big holds and salvation at the top. A couple of longer draws can help with rope drag on the dog-leg. Stay to the right of the small tree, and maybe use a couple extendable draws to help with rope drag.
content.location: Second route from the left on the wall.
